p: Other terpenes that have reported cytotoxic effects on cancer cells include alloocimene, camphor, beta-myrcene, pinene, alpha- and gamma-thujaplicin, terpinene, thymohydroquinone, carvone, camphene, and cymene (Sobral et al. 2014). Terpenes being natural compounds are unlikely to affect the healthy cells or create a side effect, which attracts many researchers to exploit its capability in cancer treatment.
